nodes.text: Tony Pope (March 22, 1947 – February 11, 2004) was a voice actor who provided voices for many cartoon movies and series, including The Jetsons, James Bond Jr., Who Framed Roger Rabbit, Akira, and Digimon: Digital Monsters, in addition to video games such as Sam and Max Hit the Road, Diablo II, and Kingdom Hearts.

Pope voiced C-3PO and an A-wing pilot in the Star Wars Trilogy Arcade coin-operated video game; C-3PO, Yoda, and the Death Star Commander in LucasArts' strategy game Star Wars: Rebellion; and C-3PO and two other characters in the audio drama Rebel Mission to Ord Mantell.
